result.execSummary:
The defendant Alfonso Dequan Fields was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
AODA assessment and follow through with recommended programming.
Random urine screens

miscConds.notes:
Fine of $100.00 plus all mandatory cost, fees and assessments, balance to be paid  by the end of the probationary period.
OR Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment.
Provide DNA Sample and pay cost of DNA Surcharge.
Court will consider motion for expungement if defendant pays the fine and costs are paid in full  within the  1 year probationary period and Obtain a Valid Driver's license.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alfonso Dequan Fields

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing hearing held:
Statements made by the State, Defense counsel and Defendant.

Court WITHHELD the sentence and placed Defendant on Probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 1 YEAR with the following conditions as to probation are as follows: 
AODA assessment and follow through with recommended programming.
Random urine screens
No new  tickets for marijuana.
Fine of $100.00 plus all mandatory cost, fees and assessments, balance to be paid  by the end of the probationary period.
OR Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment.
Provide DNA Sample and pay cost of DNA Surcharge.

NOTE:  
Court directs the Clerk of Courts Office to notify the Department of Motor Vehicles that  ZERO DAYS (0 days) REVOCATION should be imposed in this case.
Court will consider motion for expungement if defendant pays the fine and costs are paid in full  within the  1 year probationary period and Obtain a Valid Driver's license.

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant Alfonso Dequan Fields in court with attorney Angel Lee Johnson.  
Sarah Zwach appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: sm

Plea Hearing held:
Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.

Jury Trial calendared for 4-18-2016 is vacated, parties proceed to sentencing.

Defendant Alfonso Dequan Fields in court with attorney Angel Lee Johnson.  Sarah Zwach appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47.  Case remains calendared for jury trial on 4/19/2016 at 8:30 am.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Alfonso Dequan Fields in court with attorney Angel Lee Johnson.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Court ordered case adjourned for final pre-trial conference and jury trial in Branch 47.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 8, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for April 18, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Alfonso Dequan Fields in court with attorney Angel Lee Johnson.  Katherine M Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 21, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances during pendency of case.

ADDRESS INFO for Alfonso Dequan Fields
Current: 2219 N 29th St, Milwaukee, WI 53206   (Effective: 11-22-2015)
Prior: 5474 N. 56th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53218

Defendant Alfonso Dequan Fields in court with attorney Joan E. Zawikowski.  Defendant Alfonso Dequan Fields in custody.  William Patrick Pipp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Alfonso Dequan Fields not in court.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, recompense is not an issue.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 06-17-2015 at 01:30pm
